comment: He's very smart and loves what he does. Syllabus changed every week it seemed like because of the level of difficulty of one of the projects, it was ROUGH. Will meet with you or set up online chats to help you. Chapter quizzes were tough but gives opportunities to make up bad grades. Be honest in class if you don't understand something.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: GO to class and youll at least get a B
Hes an average teacher at best. Doesnt really teach much out of the textbook. Usually would just discuss whatever he felt like that did not pertain to the tests. Stay away
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough

comment: AVOID!!!! I don't think he gets how much of a bad professor he is. He thinks he is being funny, but honestly, it's just really annoying because he does NOT teach. I plead that you avoid this professor unless you enjoy teaching yourself.

This professor does not teach. He makes you watch videos, and then you discuss them. He barely goes over any actual material, and you'll learn more from just reading yourself than actual class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he does call out names for participation which is 10% of the overall grade. Doesn't give any help for studying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests? Not many

comment: Go to class and speak up. Be an adult and you'll be just fine

I took  Prof Schulzke for Legal and Ethical Environment of Business. Class mostly consisted of reviewing the material and applying the concepts to real world cases. He wouldn't reopen quizzes on connect so be wary if you're joining the class late. All of his tests were online (including the final) and not that hard if you studied.

Now that I'm in the middle of another bus prof's class, I realize that Prof Schulzke is a pretty neat dude.  Tries to keep it interesting and will respect you if you respect him.  Stay involved throughout the semester and enjoy the interactive game days he does!  Would def take again (wishing I had)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very knowledgeable prof. Tough class but he really tries to keep it interesting (ethical real world issues, games). Extremely fair and reasonable about grading. 10 out of 10 would take again.

Really enjoyed this class. He gives you a lot of real world applications and keeps lectures interesting even w/a bland topic like acct. Very knowledgeable, funny guy. Be respectful and be involved and you'll do great. Definitely would recommend and would take again.
If I remember correctly, he told stories in class that weren't relevant to what we were going to be tested on... Could of spent that time teaching us material that we could use on the test...
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you want to pass accounting do not take him. He does not teach clearly. The test does not reflect the lectures or homework they reflect the book. This is probably the worst professor I have taken my entire college career. If you can avoid him at all cost.

Alright I guess. I didnt learn as much as I wanted. We read a lot of articles and discussed them in class. His tests are subjective and all answers are up for interpretation, but he is a fair grader. His vast intelligence may come off as arrogance but he is actually very laid back. If you are respectful to him then he returns the gesture.

He just isn't a great professor.  At first, I thought he wasn't that terrible but slowly as the semester went by he kept talking down to students. He will also tell you to do one thing one day and then deny that he said it. His class isn't impossible to pass, but he sure makes it a terrible learning experience

One of the worst professors I've had at KSU. He is very rude to students when you ask questions and never fully answers your questions. His tests are very tough. He does take attendance randomly. When I contacted him via email he was always very rude with his responses. I was lucky to even pass the class.
Quite possibly the worst professor I've ever had. He is both unprofessional through emails and unhelpful in explaining the material. Do not take if you are not an accounting major. Tests are hard.

If you're not an accounting major I wouldn't suggest this guy. When you ask him a question, he'll respond with a question. His lectures are laden with sarcasm and vagueness. You can easily skip classes and get a good grade. A few hours practicing on the Connect site will do better than his lectures. He does periodically take attendance though.

Lectures aren't terrible, all homework and tests are online and are very easy, even the final exam. Once he even gave extra credit on the final for just coming to class. Easy A. Would recommend for anyone!
His lectures are not too bad if you're interested in stuff like that. I absolutely hated the information in his class but the grading is pretty easy and simple.

He's definitely a tough professor but part of the difficulty comes with the material itself. I never went to class (except test days), did all the homework & quizzes, studied for about 3-4 hours before the final, and ended up with an A.

had this professor for two different classes, both acct 2200 and blaw 2200. hard exams but easy homework. throws a curve where necessary and is a funny guy. go to class, pay attention, and let him know you're there. speak up and be involved. you'll be just fine.

Absolutely the worst professor I have ever encountered in my college experience. There was a technical error on a project, even though I clearly had proof of the error, accused me of cheating when I asked about it. Very rude, arrogant, and a waste of time! Would NEVER even speak his name again, let alone suffer through another class!

I thought he was a nice guy. Some of the topics were pretty dry (such is accounting) and he would talk about ethical issues and other things that weren't exactly helpful. Nonetheless, he did have guests speakers, which was nice, and he seemed to know what he was talking about. Smart guy, but not a very effective at communicating the subject matter.

When i started his class, I was weary about him. After a couple weeks, he actually turned out to be a pretty cool professor. It's in your best interest to be noticed by him. Gives extra credit by having you listen to presentations from professionals that he knows. Understanding. Explains everything clearly in class. Recommend

Not a bad professor. Pay attention in class though, part of the tests are book based and the other part is lecture based. He has some interesting discussions, but they can sometimes drag or be hard to follow. Never found him arrogant, rude or disrespectful.
By far my least favorite class ive taken in college or high school. Not very clear and very arrogant and his teaching skills are non existent
incompetent and useless.  Wasted a semester and learned nothing.  Unprepared and grades off for technology issues even though he continually had his own technology issues.

Very arrogant and unorganized.  Will never admit to being wrong even when he's made an obvious errors. Please do not subject yourself to his torture if you can. Worse professor I have had in my entire academic career.

Entire class was rather confusing. Sylb. was not complete until week3, most assignments turned in left you with your fingers cross hoping you understood the instructions. With that being said, He did give a great deal of leeway in grading. This is a Graduate Course and does require hard work. This is EXACTLY what I expected of an BMA course

Does not leave any stone unturned to make you miserable. really miserable. Try yourself if you want to have firsthand experience.  Can be recommended as worst professor on the planet earth. will surely win. What a wate of time and money on this MBA ACCT 8000 course!!! Stay Away if you can. Believe those nice comments at your own risk.
not a good teahcer overall. not helpful at all.

I was worried when I read the reviews but once you make it past the first two weeks the class it not difficult. Mr. Schulzke provides a lot of outside readings and all of the tests are online. This class is not hard as long as you stay on task. I enjoyed Mr Schulzke's discussions

He is a horrible professor, who lacks the ability to teach. He is extremely arrogant as well (both in person and in emails). He makes you do a journal every day, but it isn't really a journal it's a ton of papers. Don't get it done at the last minute like some classmates or you will be writing a 16 page, single-spaced, 11-point font paper.

I loved this class and the professor. He is so knowledgeable. I can say that this is the 1st class that I will not forget after the semester is over. You will use what you learned for life. Tricky test questions but he is very fair grading. I recommend this professor and I would take him again if I could.
HARD! PAY ATTENTION TO EVERY LITTLE THING HE SAYS AND ALL DETAILS IN THE BOOK. VERY ARROGANT. TALKS TO YOU AS IF YOU ARE LOWER THAN HIM.

He's a good teacher and a pretty interesting guy. However, his tests poorly measure the students grasp on the material. About half the test are problems, which are challenging but fair. The rest is just a scavenger hunt to find insignificant details out of the book. Even with that said, he's not near as bad as people make him out to be.

Have not taken this class yet. Was trying to ask if i can miss a class. This is waht I got back: Thanks for your note. "First, a point of protocol. This is a University and I am an Associate Professor. The proper salutation for professors is "professor" or "doctor," not "Mr." I prefer "Professor". Thanks.  Kind regards, Prof. Schulzke"

Very valuable class. Lacks expected organization. Slow with feedback. Final is hard to be hard, not because it helps you learn. Text is difficult. Lots of simulations, which are fun. Take, but stay up on reading, prepare seriously for negotiations.  Devote a lot of time to the final (looking up exact wording from several assigned texts/sources.)

You have to pay attention in class and the midterm is tricky.  Read the questions carefully and pick the best possible answer.  Don't just stop if one sounds good.  Simulations can be hard if you get people who lie or don't understand the rules. Valuable class and I had a fun time.

This man is unorganized, rude, and arrogant! he expects you to rent the movies for the midterm. He is unclear about all of his instructions... I would not reccomend his class to anyone, steer clear of him. I am an honor student and I will be lucky to get a C in his course.

I took schulze for negitiations which was an amazing class and highly recommended. He has some very christian views and likes to preach to his class. I find that to be a big turn off but his ability to teach and the class was a lot of fun.
Very knowledgeable. He expects you to work in his class. Pay very close attention to his remarks in class as they do show up on test.
entertaining presenter, but don't expect assignments to be graded timely or consistently deductions for the same mistake vary widely from student to student
Negotiations class was incredible. Kurt is one of the best teachers I ever had and I'll always be grateful I had him as part of my grad. program.
Gets defensive when wrong
No Comments
